snippet: Admiral Larson was appointed superintendent of the academy for a second time in 1994 when the Navy sought his help in changing the ethical atmosphere after 134 midshipmen were accused of cheating on an exam.
abstract: Charles R Larson, four-star admiral of the United States Navy who twice led United States Naval Academy and helped it recover from cheating scandal, dies at age 77.
lead_paragraph: Admiral Larson was appointed superintendent of the academy for a second time in 1994 when the Navy sought his help in changing the ethical atmosphere after 134 midshipmen were accused of cheating on an exam.

headline.main: Adm. Charles R. Larson, 77, Dies; Twice Led Naval Academy
headline.print_headline: Adm. C. R. Larson, 77; Twice Led Academy
